A typical interactive video will likely contain at least two audio tracks â€” a spoken informative audio track and a musical [soundtrack](/doxee-platform/docs/pvideo-designer-soundtrack) playing at a lower volume in the background. This article takes a closer look at integrating audio elements, including text-to-speech (TTS), into an interactive video.

## Add audio
To add an audio track to the selected scene or pop-up:

- Open the **scene editor**.

- In the **sidebar**, go to **Audio **&gt; **Sounds**.

- Select one of the audio tracks and click **Add**.

The selected audio track will be added to the timeline.

> Note

Audio tracks are distinct from the [Project soundtrack](/doxee-platform/docs/pvideo-designer-soundtrack). A scene or pop-up can have its own, additional audio track (or multiple audio tracks), which will be played simultaneously with the soundtrack. This should be taken into account when designing the audio layer of an interactive video, especially if it consists of several scenes and pop-ups.

### Configure audio tracks
Click on the audio element in the playback area or its timeline layer to open the settings:

- **Duration**

**Playback rate:** Use the slider to adjust the playback rate (speed) of the audio track

- **Start and End timestamps:** Enter the exact timestamps to control the start and end of the element

- **Volume:** Use the slider to adjust the volume of the audio track

> Note

This is a distinct setting from the volume of the [Project soundtrack](/doxee-platform/docs/pvideo-designer-soundtrack).

- **Replace media:** Choose a different audio track to replace the current one.

- **Delete:** Delete this element and its timeline layer

![Audio settings interface showing duration, playback rate, volume, and media options.](data:image/png;base64,)

## Add text-to-speech (TTS)
To add an info overlay to the selected scene or pop-up:

- Open the **scene editor**.

- In the **sidebar**, go to **Audio **&gt; **Text-to-speeck**.

- Click **Add text-to-speech**.

A TTS element will be added to the timeline. In contrast to other elements, it has to be configured before it can be perceived in the video playback.

### Configure TTS elements
Click on the TTS element in the playback area or its timeline layer to open the settings:

- **Duration**

**Playback rate:** Use the slider to adjust the playback rate (speed) of the audio track

- **Start and End timestamps:** Enter the exact timestamps to control the start and end of the element

- **Volume:** Use the slider to adjust the volume of the audio track

> Note

This is a distinct setting from the volume of the [Project soundtrack](/doxee-platform/docs/pvideo-designer-soundtrack).

- **Text**

**Voice:** Select a voice identity to be used for the TTS track

- **Script:** Enter a script to be read by the TTS voice

> Tip: Use AI to generate a script

Instead of entering the exact script to be used for TTS generation, you can use it as an AI prompt. Simply write your prompt in natural language in the text input field and click **Generate a script for me**. The Pvideo AI engine will create a fitting script text which you can edit and personalize before generating the TTS track.

- **Generate **or **Update:** Generates or regenerates the TTS track from the text script provided above

- **Download:** Download the generated TTS track as an MP3 file

- **Delete:** Delete this element and its timeline layer

![Text to speech settings interface showing duration, playback rate, and volume controls.](data:image/png;base64,)

## Upload your own files
To use your own audio files, they must be uploaded to the file drive:

- Open the **scene editor**.

- In the **sidebar**, open the **Audio **palette.

- Click **My files** &gt; **Upload** and select a file from your local storage.

> Info

Only one file can be uploaded at a time. The supported audio formats are:

**MP3**

- Add the uploaded file to the scene or pop-up.

### FAQ
#### What types of audio tracks can be included in an interactive video?
A scene or pop-up can have multiple audio and TTS tracks, in addition to the globally set Project soundtrack. Therefore, an interactive video may contain a large and complex soundscape. This should be taken into account for the sound design.

#### Is the volume setting for audio tracks the same as the Project soundtrack volume?
No, the volume setting for audio tracks is distinct from the volume of the Project soundtrack.

#### What is text-to-speech (TTS) and how can I add it to my video?
Text-to-speech (TTS) is a feature that converts text into spoken audio. To add TTS, open the **scene editor**, go to **Audio **&gt; **Text-to-speech**, and click **Add text-to-speech**. Enter a script and select the voice identity to read it, and click **Generate** to create the spoken audio track.
